ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Yes indeed! But still you deny the Judgement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Even then you deny the Judgement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: No indeed; (the fact is that) you deny the Reckoning, declaring it a lie;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Despite this, you deny the Day of Judgment,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Not at all – but rather you deny the establishment of Justice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay! But you deny (the Day of) Ad-Din.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! but you give the lie to the judgment day,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No indeed; but you cry lies to the Doom;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but ye deny the Judgment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Yet you deny the Last Judgement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! Aye, ye belie the the Requital.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No! Indeed, you deny the Retribution.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nay! But ye do reject Right and Judgment!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay! But you deny the Recompense (reward for good deeds and punishment for evil deeds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! But you deny the Recompense.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [82:9] No indeed! — a deterrent against letting oneself be misled by the generosity of God, exalted be He. Rather   you, that is, disbelievers of Mecca, deny Judgement, requital for deeds;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay) truly, (but they) the Quraysh (deny the Judgement) and the Reckoning.
